channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken glass on pathway butts wood, 11th February
item.description:
Broken glass on pathway butt's wood This has been hear 3 days

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bentham Road, Thamesmead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes and even worse supposed repair just after merton school exit heading southbound, 11th February
item.description:
I reported these potholes last month under 8843939. that same day there was a vehicle "fixing" them. It turns out they only attempted to fill one hole out of the many in a 25 ft area, The one attempted has been left in a shocking state making it even worse for road users, the holes have not been filled just a load of gravel chucked all over it and which is even harder to avoid. How much money did Bexley council waste on this contractor who cannot even fix a pothole properly. I would suggest someone visits this area to see the damage this has left and employ someone different to fix this issue before someone dies

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Lane, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verge and paving, 11th February
item.description:
I have ref number 8846668 you’ve told me doesn’t meet requirement to be repaired. I’ve got photos and video and sending to Louis French MP . Total mess made by contractor on site now no regard for public safety and I don’t see why I’m paying council tax for you to ignore.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Hill Park, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road moving around area of man hole, could have sink hole issues, 11th February
item.description:
The road moves when a vehicle passes over it, approximately 4 m2 of road around the man hole is moving under load, symptomatic of a sink hole.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Masons Hill, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 476A Kingsland Road, 11th February
item.description:
Nearby shops having a clearout and dumping items such as wooden pallets dumped by a tree outside 476A
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Between n3 and n15, 11th February
item.description:
I'm not sure what type of issue to report this as. The water in the drain on the side of number 3 has been flowing extremely loudly recently, to a worrying volume I've never heard before. There is a pothole and general damage in the road that seems very new and to have developed quickly, with water constantly filling these up, so I worry that this is related and that there's some issue with flooding or foundation crumbling under the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ingham Road, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bins left on street, 11th February
item.description:
The rubbish bins from 124/126 Millfields Rd are now being left on the street and not in the gap in front. This is causing them to overflow on to the street and has been this way for a week.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Millfields Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
